ANU.name: Naomi Clarke
interest: Neglected tropical disease epidemiologyControl of neglected tropical diseasesInfant and child health
ANU.biography: Naomi Clarke is an Honorary research fellow in the Department of Global Health, Research School of Population Health. Her research focuses on the control of neglected tropical diseases, in particular soil-transmitted helminths and scabies.

publication.title: Differential effect of mass deworming and targeted deworming for soil-transmitted helminth control in children: a systematic review and meta-analysis
Efficacy of anthelminthic drugs and drug combinations against soil-transmitted helminths: a systematic review and network meta-analysis
publication.source: Clinical Infectious Diseases, vol. 68, no. 1, pp. 96-105

publication.title: Investigating the differential impact of school and community-based integrated control programmes for soil-transmitted helminths in Timor-Leste: the (S)WASH-D for Worms pilot study protocol
publication.source: Pilot and Feasibility Studies, vol. 2, no. 69, pp. 10pp

publication.title: Quantitative Polymerase Chain Reaction for Diagnosis of Soil-Transmitted Helminth Infections: A Comparison with a Flotation-Based Technique and an Investigation of Variability in DNA Detection
publication.source: American Journal of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene, vol. 99, no. 4, pp. 1033-1040

publication.title: The expansion of soil-transmitted helminth control strategies - Authors
Use of quantitative PCR to assess the efficacy of albendazole against Necator americanus and Ascaris spp. in Manufahi District, Timor-Leste
publication.source: Parasites and Vectors, vol. 11, no. 373, pp. 7pp

publication.title: Protocol for a cluster-randomised controlled trial evaluating the impact of a preschool-based capacity building intervention on intimate partner violence and substance misuse in Sri Lanka
publication.source: BMC Public Health, vol. 18, no. 1, pp. 1-9
